title: Designing General and Content-Neutral Instructional Strategies in Electronic Education Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and experience with online learning
context.additional_context: Operated in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment, applying a summative assessment-centered evaluation system.

learning_goals: Learners can interpret machine-readable instructional strategy language with over 80% accuracy in an e-learning environment.
Learners can design three or more general instructional strategies for given mathematical content.
Learners can perform peer feedback activities with over 90% participation on an LMS-based platform.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
